alert.note: Alert for Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 10:00PM EST until January 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST TUESDAY... ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches in the most persistent lake snows. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will produce blowing and drifting snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Oswego county. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 PM EST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM to 1 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered and slippery road conditions with reduced visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Lake effect snow will fall in relatively narrow bands. If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities. Submit snow reports through our website or social media. This is a potentially dangerous situation to be outdoors. If you must be outside, be sure to cover all exposed skin. Frostbite can occur in 30 minutes or less with apparent temperatures of 15 below zero or colder.
